Course Description: THIS COURSE IS AN EXAMINATION OF BUDGETING, ACCOUNTING, REPORTING STANDARDS AND PRACTICES FOR GOVERNMENTAL AND NONPROFIT ENTITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.	IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN THE CHARACTERISTICS THAT DISTINGUISH GOVERNMENTAL AND NONPROFIT ENTITIES FROM PROFIT ENTITIES. 
2.	DEFINE THE AUTHORITATIVE BODIES RESPONSIBLE FOR SETTING FINANCIAL REPORTING STANDARDS FOR GOVERNMENTAL AND NONPROFIT ENTITIES.  
3.	CONTRAST AND COMPARE THE OBJECTIVES OF FINANCIAL REPORTING FOR GOVERNMENTAL AND NONPROFIT ENTITIES. 
4.	EXPLAIN HOW MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS, BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND REPORTING SUPPLEMENTARY INFORMATION OF STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS RELATE TO THEIR COMPREHENSIVE ANNUAL FINANCIAL REPORTS. 
5.	DESCRIBE THE DIFFERENT OBJECTIVES, MEASUREMENT FOCUS, AND BASIS OF ACCOUNTING OF THE GOVERNMENT-WIDE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FUND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
